List of winners: 2014 American Music Awards

Which of your favorite music artists took home trophies Sunday night?

List of winners: 2014 American Music Awards

USA TODAY 11:20 p.m. EST November 23, 2014
Taylor Swift opened the 2014 American Music Awards at the Nokia Theatre in Los Angeles at Nov. 23, 2014, performing 'Blank Space.' (Photo: Matt Sayles, Matt Sayles/Invision/AP)
Fullscreen
Taylor Swift refers to her 'Blank Space' video for the AMAs' opening number. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Charli XCX starts her performance off sweetly with 'Boom Clap.' (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Charli XCX performs 'Break the Rules.' (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Luke Hemmings of 5 Seconds of Summer jumps into the band's performance. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Nasri of Magic! and Wyclef Jean perform 'Rude.' (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Annalise Bishop Foxx and Jamie Foxx speak onstage, before presenting the award for favorite rap/hip-hop album to Iggy Azalea. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Iggy Azalea and her mentor T.I. appear onstage as she accepts the award for best rap/hip-hop album. "This is the first award I've ever won in my entire life," she said. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Dan Reynolds of Imagine Dragons performs the band's new single, 'I Bet My Life.' (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Iggy Azalea begins her performance with 'Fancy.' (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Sam Smith accepts the Favorite Pop/Rock Male Artist award. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
A$AP Rocky hits the stage to rap alongside Sam Smith, who won the Favorite Male Pop/Rock Artist award. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Luke Bryan accepts the Favorite Country Male Artist award. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Lorde dances it out to her 'Hunger Games: Mockingjay - Part 1' theme song 'Yellow Flicker Beat.' (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Ariana Grande performs, starting off with a piano-accompanied medley of hits like 'Problem' and 'Break Free.' (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Ne-Yo and host Pitbull break it down during their joint performance. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
A somber Selena Gomez performs her new song 'The Heart Wants What It Wants' (reportedly about Justin Bieber). (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Skylar Grey hit the piano to sing the hook for Nicki Minaj's new song 'Bed of Lies.' (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Christina Milian teamed up with Lil Wayne. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Fergie sings her new single 'L.A.LOVE.' (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Diana Ross presents the first-ever Dick Clark Award for Excellence to Taylor Swift, who praised the icon for paving the way for smart women in music. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
As she accepts the Dick Clark Award for Excellence, Taylor Swift thanks her fans, who she says value albums and the idea that music has value as art. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Mary J. Blige performs her new song 'Therapy,' co-penned by AMA winner Sam Smith. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Host Pitbull chats it up with BFFs Lorde, Taylor Swift and model Karlie Kloss during the show. (Photo: Jeff Kravitz/AMA2014, FilmMagic)
Fullscreen
Jessie J, Nicki Minaj and Ariana Grande belt (and rap) their way through a golden rendition of 'Bang Bang.' (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Niall Horan, Harry Styles, Liam Payne, Zayn Malik and Louis Tomlinson of One Direction accept the Artist of the Year award. The boy band took home three out of three honors for which it was nominated, including the night's top prize. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Jennifer Lopez (here) and Iggy Azalea brought their 'Booty' to the AMAs, performing to close the show. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen
Jennifer Lopez closes out the show. (Photo: Kevin Winter, Getty Images)
Fullscreen

    Liam Payne, Niall Horan, Louis Tomlinson, Zayn Malik, and Harry Styles of One Direction.(Photo: Jason Merritt, Getty Images)

    Music's biggest names converged on Los Angeles on Sunday night for the 2014 American Music Awards.

    List of nominees and winners (bolded):

    Artist of the Year

    Iggy Azalea
    Beyonc
    Luke Bryan
    Eminem
    Imagine Dragons
    John Legend
    Lorde
    One Direction
    Katy Perry
    Pharrell Williams

    Favorite Female Artist Soul/R&B

    Jhen Aiko
    Beyonc
    Mary J. Blige

    Favorite Female Artist Country

    Miranda Lambert
    Kacey Musgraves
    Carrie Underwood

    Favorite Artist Contemporary Inspirational

    Casting Crowns
    Hillsong United
    Newsboys

    Favorite Album Country

    Blame It on My Roots: Five Decades of Influences, Garth Brooks
    The Outsiders, Eric Church
    Just as I Am, Brantley Gilbert

    Favorite Artist Rap/Hip-Hop

    Iggy Azalea
    Drake
    Eminem

    USATODAY

    2014 AMAs: Red-carpet looks

    New Artist of the Year

    5 Seconds of Summer
    Iggy Azalea
    Bastille
    Sam Smith
    Meghan Trainor

    Favorite Artist Alternative Rock

    Bastille
    Imagine Dragons
    Lorde

    Favorite Female Artist Pop/Rock

    Iggy Azalea
    Lorde
    Katy Perry

    Favorite Album Pop/Rock

    Pure Heroine, Lorde
    Midnight Memories, One Direction
    Prism, Katy Perry

    Favorite Male Artist Country

    Jason Aldean
    Luke Bryan
    Blake Shelton

    Favorite Male Artist Pop/Rock

    John Legend
    Sam Smith
    Pharrell Williams

    Favorite Artist Latin

    Marc Anthony
    Enrique Iglesias
    Romeo Santos

    Favorite Album Rap/Hip-Hop

    The New Classic, Iggy Azalea
    Nothing Was the Same, Drake
    The Marshall Mathers LP 2, Eminem

    Favorite Band, Duo or Group Pop/Rock

    Imagine Dragons
    One Direction
    OneRepublic

    Single of the Year

    Fancy, Iggy Azalea Featuring Charli XCX
    All of Me, John Legend
    Rude, Magic!
    Dark Horse, Katy Perry Featuring Juicy J
    Happy, Pharrell Williams

    Favorite Band, Duo or Group Country

    Eli Young Band
    Florida Georgia Line
    Lady Antebellum

    Favorite Male Artist Soul/R&B

    Chris Brown
    John Legend
    Pharrell Williams

    Favorite Album Soul/R&B

    Beyonc, Beyonc
    Love in the Future, John Legend
    G I R L, Pharrell Williams

    Favorite Artist Adult Contemporary

    Sara Bareilles
    OneRepublic
    Katy Perry

    Favorite Artist Electronic Dance Music (EDM)

    Avicii
    Calvin Harris
    Zedd

    Top Soundtrack

    Frozen
    The Fault in Our Stars
    Guardians of the Galaxy: Awesome Mix, Vol. 1
